metadata.title: Wednesday, 12th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Labour and Social Security
parts: (a)    whether the Government will intervene in the problems that have arisen from implementing the new payroll system at Konkola Copper Mines Plc;
(b)    whether the trade unions were consulted prior to implementation of the new payroll; and
(c)    if so, what the position of the unions on the matter was.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)    whether the Government has any plans to make the Barotse Plains a World Heritage Site;
(b)    how much consultation with the local stakeholders has already taken place prior to declaring the Barotse Plains as a World Heritage Site;
(c)    what developmental benefits the local community will accrue from the declaration; and
(d)    what the declaration of the plains as a World Heritage Site entails.

questions.minister: Vice President how often District Commissioners undergo training in governance matters of the country.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the main canal in Lunga District will be dredged; and
(b)    whether the Government has any plans to procure dredgers for use in Lunga District and other flood prone areas like Mitete in Western Province.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing when the following feeder roads in Chikankata District will be upgraded to bituminous standard
parts: (a)    Chikani-Simwaambwa;
(b)    Idaf-Mulawo;
(c)    Upper Kaleya-Nameembo; and
(d)    Hospital-Hampande-Kasaka.

questions.minister: Minister of Agriculture and Livestock when dip tanks will be constructed in the following areas in Nakonde Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Shem;
(b)    Chanka;
(c)    Musundano;
(d)    Ntatumbila;
(e)    Chawa;
(f)    Uzinji;
(g)    Ntenko;
(h)    Chilolwa;
(i)    Chiwale;
(j)    Nchenga; and
(k)    Kantongo.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    who the shareholders of the following mining companies are:
(i)    Lumwana; and (ii)    First Quantum Minerals;
(b)    how much money, in taxes, the two companies paid to the Government from 2010 to 2013, year by year; and
(c)    whether the two companies were tax compliant during the period at (b).

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how much money was owed to teachers, in form of salary arrears, country-wide as of 30th September, 2013;
(b)    how the arrears arose; and
(c)    when the arrears will be cleared.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when the Government will construct teachers’ houses and classroom blocks at the following schools in Magoye Parliamentary Constituency
parts: (a)    Namaila;
(b)    Chijanwa;
(c)    Kalama;
(d)    Mukuyu;
(e)    Nziba;
(f)    Munenga;
(g)    Mainza;
(h)    Simwaba;
(i)    Mbiya; and
(j)    Matimbya.

questions.minister: Minister of Commerce, Trade and Industry
parts: (a)    what the total number of small and medium scale enterprises (SMEs) engaged in the export industry was as of 30th September, 2013; and
(b)    what products are manufactured by the SMEs.
(a)    why construction of staff houses at Ndoka Bridge Clinic in Kalabo Central Parliamentary Constituency has stalled;
(b)    when the construction will resume;
(c)    what the name of the contractor is;
(d)    what the cost of the project is; and
(e)    what the time-frame for completion of the project is.
(a)    when the implementation of the 2012 and 2013 health projects in Chipili District will commence;
(b)    what has caused the delay in commencing project implementation; and
(c)    what measures have been taken to avoid delays in commencement of project implementation in the future.
(a)    when the Government will construct a modern regional Police Headquarters in North-Western Province; and
(b)    when the Government will establish police posts at Mukumbi Turn-off and Chovwe in Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication when the Government will rehabilitate the road from Nyimba to Katete District along the border between Zambia and Mozambique.
Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when a road from Wamafwa to Ifumba in Chovwe area and a permanent bridge on the Chovwe River will be constructed;
(b)    when Government officers last visited Chovwe, Wamafwa and Ifumba areas to inspect the road infrastructure; and
(c)    what their findings and recommendations on the status of the roads were.
